metadata.Title: CVE-2018-14642 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An information leak vulnerability was found in Undertow. If all headers are not written out in the first write() call then the code that handles flushing the buffer will always write out the full contents of the writevBuffer buffer, which may contain data from previous requests.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-14642` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libundertow-java - 2.0.23-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: undertow package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.23-1').
